Description:
string
 Human readable description of the error
To Customer Doc?: If the fault need to be documented in the customer facing doc? [yes/no]
To HMC Code?: If the fault need to be supported by the HMC? [yes/no]
Blast Radius:
one of: node|vm|device|process|none
 None = No impact
 Process = User mode app kill
 device = System drops device (EG; GPU fall off bus)
 VM = virtual machine termination
 Node = Whole server must go down
System Behavior Description:
string
 Human readable description of expected system behavior
Fault XID/SXIDs:
Catalog List OR Empty
 [xid1 | inband/oob/both]; [sxid2]; ... "inband" = event will only be visibile in the inband XID log.  "both" = event is present in both inband and out of band XIDs
Hardware/GPIO Signal:
String OR Blank
 Expected OOB signal for the error. EG: I2C1_ALERT_N
Recovery Telemetry:
Catalog List OR Empty
 [Telem-CatalogID | Value]; [Telem-CatalogID2 | Value]
Self-Test (?): TBD Info needed for self test
RF Log Producer:
One of: HMC | BMC
 What entity is responsible for the OOB event generation. (TBD: May change per program, how to handle?)
RF Log URI: What Redfish URI the log will go to?
RF Log Message ID:
String
 Redfish Log event log entry message ID
RF Log Message Args:
Catalog List
 Redfish message args pattern list
 [Arg1]; [Arg2]; ...
MessageArgs Parameters:
If any patterns in RF Log Message Args, the pattern population info should be put here accordingly. Since the pattern could contain multiples, separate them by ':'. e.g.
[ type | DBUS ];[ Interface | /xyz/openbmc_project/...];[.. | ..]:[ type | CMDLINE ];[ executable| fpga_regtbl];[.. | ..]:...
RF Log Severity:
String
 Value of severity field in redfish log
RF Log Resolution:
String
 Text content of resolution field in redfish log
RF Log Origin Of Condition:
String
 Expected OOC in the redfish log
CPER Vendor Section:
Yes | No
 Is this a vendor section with a type header?
CPER Vendor Type Value: If Vendor Section = Yes, hex value of vendor type
Supporting Service: This contains the internal HMC/BMC service that is responsible for generating this error. This is
Event Name: Internal name of the event to appear in AML logs and event AdditionalData
Device Type: DeviceID pattern determining what URIs the event would appear on Redfish
Layer: which category in the 6-layer model the event falls into
Trigger data config: DataAccessor (without check) with what telemetry to subscribe to
Trigger check: What value the trigger must have to proceed with checking the accessor and recovery
Accessor data config: DataAccessor (without check) with what telemetry to access after the trigger check has been satisfied
Accessor check: What value the accessor must have to generate the event
Recovery data config: DataAccessor (without check) with what telemetry to access after the trigger check has been satisfied (can be empty).   Kun/Andrew - does this overlap with recovery telemetry column?
Recovery check: What value the recovery accessor must have to recover the event (can be empty)
Leaky bucket trigger count: How many times the event must have occurred before an event log is generated
Data value is event count: Whether or not the data value of the accessor is already a count of number of times the event occurred
Leaky bucket reset type: Configuration for how to reset the leaky bucket value (for example, on DC state transition) TODO: should add an enumerated list of supported options here
AdditionalData data config (possibly mul: Additional telemetries that should be included in the AdditionalData attachment of this event and their accessors

Description: Some number of CRC faults expected during nornal system operation (every 6 hours or so).  Not problematic unless RETRY leaky bucket reached.
OS-triggered FLR reset of GPU attempted.  Interrupts triggered but RAS_FW unable to clear.  Interrupts disabled.  Other C2C and CLINK CPERs possible.
Compute Complex (CCPLEX) faults defined in GIC-7000 TRM.  Uncorrectable and Correctable (error injection) errors to RAMS, SW errors.
Compute Complex (CCPLEX) faults defined in NVIDIA IP.  Some errors to RAMs, number of SW issues as well.
Seen at boot when channel is retired.  Not actionable on its own.
Chip-to-Chip (NVLink) conditions.  Some errors to R
Common Memory Error Table (CMET):  Seen when total count ofsocket errors exceed 4000.  Expect that a channel will be retired and CMET space freed up.
Common Memory Error Table (CMET):  Seen when error is reported in either primary or secondary SPI flash tables are invalid (corrupt, bad signature).  System will recover to best possible state.
Common Memory Error Table (CMET):  Seen when CMET table is initialized.  May be seen if SPI inadvertantly cleared.
Device Coherency Cache (DCC):  CPU cache coherency errors
Device Coherency Cache (DCC):  CPU cache ECC faults
Seen on every boot identifying the 30 best channels that are active for this boot.
Scratch registers from FW faults on previous system reset.  ASCII decode of FW instance.
State of GPU Containement process.  INTERNAL NOTE: expect that this CPER will be consistent as it is intended to reflect that containment has been entered (end state) and not a transition state.
Seen on every boot identifying a successful train of C2C links or failure condition details.
Hardware Safety Manager (HSM) error.  Variety of bus, memory, registry errors (parity, ECC, illegal access), timeout and glitch detection.
Hardware Safety Manager (HSM) error whihc couldnt be uniquely identified.
Hardware Safety Manager (HSM) error on fabric detected by JTAG< Coresight or CCPLEX.  All SW errors.
Patrol scrub of memory over 24 hour period.  Should be seen only with customer enabling error injection.
Patrol scrub of memory over 24 hour period.  Should be seen only with customer enabling error injection.  Seen when FIFO queue refilled for additional addresses.
Memory Controller Fault (MCF).  Variety of bus, memory, registry errors (parity, ECC, illegal access).
Informational-only reporting that the HSS reached an idel condition having exhausted pages to scrub.
CPU root port reported PCIe-related errors that could be bus/SI, host, endpoint device or SW related.
CPU root port reported PCIe CPER with UEFI-PCIE formatted content (capability, AER, etc)
System Memory Magament Unit.  Generally correctable.
IP consumed poison that it is not capable of handling.  Drives reboot to avoid propagation.
UEFI-defined Processor CPER.  Can have one of three different sub-classes of error details.
UEFI-defined memory error.  Expected to be seen along with DRAM ECC MCF CPER.
UEFI-defined PCIE error expected from end-point devices.

Fault Name: GPU I2C error - NACK from device
RF Log Resolution: Check for the device in PCIe Link Disabled State or in PCIe Secondary Bus Reset and recover the device. Power cycle the Baseboard and if the problem persists collect nvidia-bug-report from Host OS, OOB logs and dumps if available, and isolate SXM for RMA evaluation.
